document_data.mainbody:
'''''Prophet of Moonshae''''', by [[Douglas Niles]], is the first book in the [[Druidhome trilogy]], which follows the events of the [[Moonshae trilogy]].

{{quote|''The [[Ffolk]] have forsaken their goddess, the [[Earthmother]], and have turned to the new gods to protect them. Now, capricious and malevolent, one of the new lords has turned the worship of the Ffolk against them. It falls to the royal daughters of High King [[Tristan Kendrick]] to confront the evil that now threatens their land.''}}
document_data.Summary: Twenty years after the [[Darkwalker War]], [[Talos]] attempts to dominate the [[Moonshae Isles]] with his clerics working from the shadows, a servant called Coss-Axel-Sinioth, [[sahuagin]], the treacherous Earl of Blackstone, and a [[dracolich]] he tricked into his service with a promise of eternal life. Talos attempts to ignite war between the [[Ffolk]] and [[Northlander|Northmen]], but the efforts are thwarted by [[Alicia Kendrick]], who reawakens a [[Moonwell]] with the Staff of the White Well and the energy of an [[iron golem]]. Alicia, together with her tutor, a powerful [[wizard]] named [[Keane]], the [[firbolg]] [[Yak]], Hanrald Blackstone, the [[bard]] Tavish, the northman prince Brandon Olafsson, the [[faerie dragon]] [[Newt (faerie dragon)|Newt]], and the [[druid]] Danrak, manages to stop Talos, defend the moonwell, and defeat all of his servants except the sahuagin. [[Deirdre Kendrick]] is manipulated by Sinioth and nearly turns on her family but refuses at the last moment. [[Robyn Kendrick]] falls sick but recovers, and an old prophet appears and disappears inexplicably at several points, prophesizing doom and the goddesses return, even though he is slain several times. After the battle is won, it is revealed that [[Tristan Kendrick|Tristan Kendrick's]] ship has been lost at sea.
